title: Meet a Real Life Shark Scientist
address: Cape Town, South Africa· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
act_int: The No 1 Best Selling Wildlife Online Experience. Bookings support our conservation work!Great for Corporate Teams and for reconnecting families, couples & inspiring ocean enthusiasts of all ages. You will leave feeling lifted & refreshed with a healthy dose of optimism.  Rated 5 Stars by teams & individuals from Apple, Microsoft, Google, Facebook, Spotify, WWF and many more.  Are you looking for something specific? I have several formats that can be personalised to suit YOU. I host 1 - 500 guests. Send me a message!Ok, let’s set aside what you thought you knew about sharks as we adventure below the ocean’s surface - a mysterious (& scary) place, full of unspeakable monsters! Or so it seems..  Meet Sereia the Tiger shark - an ocean giant that I’m teaming up with to save us all. Follow her record breaking swim and learn how we use science & technology to uncover the secret lives of sharks. Be warned, you will shake your head in disbelief.  I will share my favourite stories, images & videos taken by myself and a team of scientists, BAFTA winners, Emmy nominees & Cinematographer of the year awardees.I can’t wait to take you to one of the most enchanting marine reserves on the planet, one that NOBODY knows about!“Like a nature documentary but you get to ask questions"
about_author: I’m on a quest to spread a little ocean optimism, and some remarkable stories of sharks.Supporting my lifelong passion through tourism & film meant adapting to 2020’s Covid crisis - so I started this unique online Experience!My desire for discovery & ocean protection has taken me to work with Manta Rays, Manatees & Trevally. Don’t forget the SHARKS - Tigers, Bulls, Great Whites, Hammerheads and more. When not working with sharks I'm exploring the vibrant octopus gardens around my home town of Cape Town.I know the ocean and her creatures inside out, so you’re guaranteed to learn loads, sharing in my adventures through the lens of a conservation scientist.I love hearing your ocean stories, encounters & fears. Share, laugh and recharge with me as we make the world (&ocean) a better place. I can't wait to hear from you!

title: Animal Sanctuary Virtual Experience
address: Canterbury, Connecticut, United States· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
act_int: ~~~~HOLIDAY SPECIAL~~~~ All tour bookings for Saturday Dec 4 and Sunday Dec 12 will be holiday themed, with the farm decorated and visits from Mr. and Ms. Claus. Limited spots available so book now!~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Our tours:You may not be able to visit us in person but you can still meet our amazing residents here! 100% of your tour fees goes directly to the animals. At The Riley Farm Rescue, we are able to bring the tour to you, virtually! These tours are interactive, engaging, and informative. They are great for groups and a fun team activity! We will take you around the farm to learn some fun facts about the animals and enjoy a virtual visit. You can hear their rescue stories and learn about their individual personalities. We can't wait to show you around!A note about booking:If you do not see an available time that works for you, please message us! We'd be happy to make time for you to meet us and our animals.
about_author: In 2017, The Riley Farm Rescue was incorporated as a non-profit and 501c3. Since then we have rescued over 100 animals who are now residents at our sanctuary. Our Vice President, Sarah, is a kindergarten teacher who does virtual live tours for students, live story-time readings with the animals, and loves to talk about the animals and educate others about their stories. Marla, our President and Founder, has dedicated her life to providing forever homes to these animals and knows them through and through. To get to know our amazing resident animals for yourself please join us for a virtual tour and meet Lucian, Murphy, Starlight, and more!

title: Spice Up Life with Thai Food
address: Bangkok, Thailand· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
act_int: We'll welcome you into our home in Bangkok virtually! Dwight, Panisha, and team will share about their charity, Thai food culture, and cook with you during this class. Each class lasts an hour, which is only enough time to cook one recipe. Due to the limited time, we provide lots of supplementary info to help with shopping for unfamiliar ingredients.Book our public class FIRST to choose from beginner recipes like pad see ew noodles, tom kha soup, and green curry. OR Book a private class for your family or group with more recipe options, including pad thai, penang curry, cocktails, and more! We also offer multi-session courses on advanced topics like Thai plant based vegan recipes, curry paste making, and homemade tofu/tempeh. We're enthusiastic about our vegetarian and vegan recipes. If you have any other dietary needs please let us know. Pricing is per student, not per device. Your seat in the public class includes access to 6 of our favorite Thai recipes, while private class students can access 15+ recipes. Be sure to send us your email address for access to the recipe courses. Private bookings are also an hour but can be up to 90 mins depending on the schedule. Booking in advance is best. Please note our time zone is ICT and there may be a delay in replying to inquires.
about_author: Dwight (@bkkfatty) and Panisha (@panisha) live in Bangkok and run Courageous Kitchen (@courageouskitchen), a Thai cooking school and charity. Together with their team, they're excited to talk about Thai food, culture, and using food for social change.We've hosted 1000s of guests in our home and are now excited to be meeting more of you virtually. Most classes are hosted by Dwight. As the founder of Courageous Kitchen, Dwight has lived in Thailand 10+ years. He's originally American, is fluent in Thai, and is an expert on Thai food and ingredients. He is also passionate about preserving Thai culture and biodiversity. Ask him about his past life living on the royal palace grounds, efforts to help feed the neediest in Bangkok, or the over 80 species of edible plants he's currently growing in his garden.

title: Dive Under the Sea with a Shark Expert
address: Cape Town, South Africa· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
act_int: A Best Selling Online Experience that supports our conservation work in South Africa! “Very entertaining, the pace and information flowed!”My interactive, fun-filled experience is rated 5 stars by individuals of all ages, and by teams from Facebook, Apple, Microsoft, Paypal, and so many more! I host anything from 1 to 500 guests and willing to personalize the session or create a time that suits you – just let me know!Expect to dive in with me as I share my 21-year career in shark conservation, shark research and campaigning in this story-telling, Shark Smart quiz, creative drawing and fact-filled experience. And I’ll give you a gift, my book called 'SHARKS' for free!You’ll find out how I went from being called Shark Bait to the Shark Warrior, and how an extraordinary shark, Maxine, changed my life. She’s sure to swim into your heart as you follow her incredible journey from captivity to freedom.I’ll share stories of my research, and my award-winning videos and photos that will lead you on an exciting underwater adventure into the oceans of the world to meet weird and wonderful sharks, including living dinosaurs! I'll answer questions like why I've never been bitten, and share secrets behind some of my crazy shark awareness campaigns done on one breath!I can’t wait to you leave feeling inspired and in awe of one of the most magnificent animals on Earth - SHARKS!
about_author: I love the ocean and sharks! I'm an award-winning conservationist, best known as the Shark Warrior because of my passionate efforts in shark conservation. Because I wanted to help save the oceans I founded a nonprofit organisation, AfriOceans, which focuses on ocean conservation. I'm also an author of children's books and educational books, an underwater and wildlife photographer, and a dive travel and expedition leader. I love freediving with sharks! I'm proud to be a Fellow of The Explorers Club, an inductee of the Women Divers Hall of Fame, and a PADI Ambassadiver.  I established Shark Warrior Adventures, a responsible tourism business and self-funding initiative of AfriOceans that aims to reconnect people to Nature through transformative wildlife experiences. I love sharing my passion for the oceans, and of sharks in particular.

title: Seal Rescue Ireland Virtual Experience
address: Courtown, Ireland· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
act_int: In this completely virtual experience, we will bring the excitement of our rescue centre directly into your home!  You will have the unique opportunity to have an in-depth look into the world of wildlife rehabilitation at Ireland's only seal rescue centre. Come meet our adorable seal pups up close and help them get one step closer to being released back into the wild! Your experience will begin with an educational talk about the different types of seals in Ireland, the threats facing them, and how you can help create a safe environment for seals in the wild. Next, we'll bring you behind the scenes for a tour of the hospital where you'll hear the stories of the rescue seals currently in care and meet them up close and personal. Learn how we keep the seals happy and mentally stimulated while in our care, how we keep them fed and gaining weight, learn about the rehabilitation process from ICU, to Kennels, to Pools and observe them dive, swim, and develop the skills they'll need to flourish in the wild!We hope you'll leave this experience with greater respect and understanding of this remarkable animal, which plays a critical role in Ireland's marine ecosystem, and feel inspired to do everything you can to help us protect them!Great for large groups and team-building!Note: This experience is priced per person, not per device. Please book accordingly.
about_author: I am the Education Manager at SRI, managing all educational programming for the charity. SRI has been around for over 10 years and have successfully rescued and released hundreds of native seals back to Irish waters. We are seal experts, regularly running tours, public outreach events, research projects, and proactive conservation efforts. We have accumulated a wealth of knowledge on marine mammals in Ireland and have a diverse team who bring a range of skillsets to our organization to deliver top-notch events. We are passionate about giving the higher quality of care possible in order to give sick, injured and orphaned pups a second chance at life out in the wild, and we would love to share this passion with you!

title: Virtual Visit to an Animal Sanctuary
address: Sonoma, California, United States· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
act_int: Did you know that cows hold grudges, pigs can play video games, and turkeys recognize their favorite humans?Join us on Zoom for a virtual visit to our sanctuary and meet a variety of rescued farm animals. We'll take you up close and personal with our animal residents, share their stories of resilience and healing, and talk a bit more about the industries they come from. You'll love meeting our animal ambassadors and may be surprised at what you learn since we so rarely see the animals in our food system.  Join us as we get up close and personal with cows, pigs, turkeys, goats, sheep and more! The Experience will last approximately 1 hour. Charlie's Acres is a 501c3 registered non-profit. All Experience proceeds go towards the care of our rescued animal residents.Great for groups and team building!Other things to notePlease download Zoom (www.zoom.us) on your phone, tablet, or computer before the experience begins.
about_author: Hi! We're Kaleigh, Jenny, Gustavo, Greg, and Lauren, the hardworking tour staff of Charlie's Acres.Kaleigh has a degree in Anthropology and Conservation and has worked in a variety of wild animal sanctuaries and animal advocacy settings.Jenny discovered her passion for animal rights advocacy during a farm sanctuary internship, and is fluent in French!Gustavo is a Bay Area native with degrees in Chemistry and Biology. In addition to teaching people about animals, he loves taking photos of our animal residents and is fluent in Spanish.Lauren grew up in LA county in an Italian family restaurant. She has been vegan since 2018 and is passionate about animal and environmental activism. Greg has a degree in Linguistics and Anthropology. With a longtime interest in animal welfare, he has 15+ years of plant-based tips to share with guests.

title: Improv at Work
address: San Francisco, California, United States· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
act_int: BATS Improv @ Work teaches that improv skills are life skills, and work skills.Whether on your own, or with family, colleagues, or friends, tiptoe out of your comfort zone as you learn some of the tools of the improviser, skills like storytelling, active listening, building on other's ideas, and the art of co-creation.Our itinerary will be a line-up of 6 to 8 facilitated activities which focus on fun, playful, interaction.  Typical game flow:- Scavenger Hunt- Three Things in Common exercise- Word at a Time Story- Improvised Slideshow- True Story Sharing games- Shared Fake Memory (a Yes, And... game)- Faux-ga (A playful fake-yoga activity)- Six Word Story Debrief (using the chat)We will meet via the Zoom platform, as a large group, the break into pairs using breakout rooms.We will have fun together.Each playful improv activity offers a chance to reflect and synthesize how the experiences connect to our lives and teams.If you need a laugh, want to meet others in a time of self-isolation, or just want to explore what improv is all about, then please join us to seek and share in this journey of connection and transformation.This Experience is perfect for team-building. Book a private experience for your group.Read reviews of our other Airbnb Experience:  https://www.airbnb.com/experiences/1690978
about_author: I am considered a master storyteller and improv coach.  I host "The Moth" StorySlam in San Francisco.  I've been a company improv player at BATS Improv since 2004.  My book, "Your Story, Well Told," was the #1 new release for Public Speaking Reference on Amazon when released (March 30, 2021).  I love bringing teams of people together through playful exercises that allow us to connect as people through our stories.  Applied Improvisation is taught to business people worldwide to improve their communication, collaboration, storytelling, presentation and active listening skills - and it's really the most fun way to learn.  I have a degree from Northwestern University and credits on dozens of movies as a VFX Artist as well.  I live in San Francisco with my wife (also an improvisor and teaching artist for young children) and 2 teenage kids.

title: Living Culture w/ Mohawk Interpretation
address: Cornwall Island, Ontario, Canada· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
act_int: Travel to the sovereign territory of Akwesasne, a Mohawk nation situated on the St. Lawrence River on the border of the U.S. and Canada. Come on an interactive journey of Mohawk culture, starting with our Creation Story and ending with present day living with Lorna and Mikayla, cultural educators at Native North American Traveling College, a cultural center dedicated to preservation, revitalization and education of Mohawk ways of life. We will teach you a few Mohawk phrases and offer friendly guidance on pronunciation. We will also share some of our music, life in the Longhouse (no we did not live in tipis), and Wampum belts, early records of stories and treaties. We will also bring out some artifacts from our expansive collection at the Native North American Traveling College. We look forward to getting to know you and sharing a bit more about ourselves. Nia:wen (Thank you!)
about_author: Kanohkwahawi Ionkiats, wakskarewake, Akwesasne nonwe tkiteron, Kanien’kehaka niwakahontsioten. Hi everybody, my Mohawk name is Kanohkwahawi which translates to “She carries her ancestors”, but you can call me Lorna. I am bear clan, I live in Akwesasne, and I’m from the Mohawk Nation. I have lived in Akwesasne most of my life. I attended the Akwesasne Freedom School, a mohawk immersion school whose curriculum is based on our seasonal/ceremonial calendar and our language. I just recently graduated from SUNY Potsdam where I majored in Women’s and Gender Studies, and minored in Museum Studies, Native Studies, and Anthropology. I now work as a cultural educator and assist in museum curation/storage at NNATC. I have also been a co-curator at SUNY Potsdam, and am currently working on a small exhibition at The Wild Center.

title: LGBTQ history with drag queens & kings performances
address: London, United Kingdom· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
time_end: 60 mins · Hosted in English and French
act_int: Celebrate queer people and uplift marginalised voices everyday. Come as you are to learn and have fun with QTIBPOC (Queer, Trans, Intersex, Black, People of colour)Please note that alternative dates/times to suit your time zone can be arranged. (Shorter experience i.e 45mins session can be arranged).  Private bookings group size for 10-100 people is also available. Get in touch :) Discover and explore a hidden side of queer history that is rarely taught in school. Get ready to take a deep dive into London’s queer history, covering everything from LGBTQ+ stories of gay royal Kings and Queens of England to the multi-facet of what it means to be LGBTQ+ in London and the importance of diverse queer voices and entertainment in our nightlife.What’s more, you will get the chance to dive even deeper with a live Q&A with the activists, followed by a glitter-soaked finale of talented drag queens and kings spoiling you with live performances.See how our pride colours flourish in our diverse community from London Pride to UK Black Pride. Everyone is welcome, solo, couples, or groups. Join with an open mind to connect, laugh, and have fun with people from around the world. This Experience is great for team-building. book a private experience for your group.
about_author: I am a  proud city-life Londoner, prominent events producer and LGBTQ+ activist that champions diversity, integration, and equality. I'm the founder of an LGBTQ+ company called 'Moonlight Experiences'- an organization dedicated to the celebration of queer culture, community & nightlife. My bespoke experiences across different cities & online are designed to educate, entertain whilst uplifting queer people of colour & amplifying marginalised voices to tackle the lack of diversity.  I am passionate about providing safe spaces, social gatherings, parties &  art exhibitions for self-expression, identity, and authentic friendships. My activism extends to the work I do as Head of Community Engagement at 'UK Black Pride' and Board of Trustees for 'GiveOut' charity.I can't wait to meet you! We are only strangers because we haven't met yet.

title: The Art of Accepting Help
address: New York, United States· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
time_end: 60 mins · Hosted in English and Spanish
act_int: How many of us are the first to offer a helping hand when it comes to others, but really struggle to get that type of help in our own life.Do you shy away from asking for help at work because of what you think your colleagues may say?  Do you have trouble asking for support in your personal life because of how you may be judged? If you want to be able to confidently ask and accept the type of help you really need to move your goals forward then The Art of Accepting help is for you. Your world is FULL of people who are simply waiting to help you. With this workshop you’ll learn how to change your mindset around receiving help by identifying your family motto and the unchecked lessons you've been taught from a young age. We'll discover how our racial, sexual, ethnic or gender identities have been used to stop us from asking for help, and exactly how to combat it.Lastly, you'll walk away with clear tips about the do’s and don'ts for getting support and learn how to directly apply them to your own life.
about_author: I've spent the last 10 years in Brooklyn using human resources and entrepreneurship to build bridges between the nonprofit world and talented leaders of color! I’ve trained over 100 entrepreneurs launch or grow their mission-driven companies. Originally from upstate New York and frustrated by weak representation of minorities in Social Impact, I founded a nonprofit  in 2017 where I help Black and Brown founders enter, navigate and thrive in the social impact field.When it comes to leveraging support, accepting a helping hand and treating opportunities to help others as a gift, I'm an expert!

title: Rio’s carnival backstage live experience
address: Rio de Janeiro, Brazil· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
time_end: 60 mins · Hosted in English, French, and Portuguese
act_int: In our LIVE behind-the-scenes experience of the Rio de Janeiro CarnIval, we are happy to offer families and coworkers from all over the world one hour of fun and exploration of a new culture.Together, we will visit LIVE the hangar where we prepare the costumes and giant floats for the biggest and most famous carnival in the world and at the end of the day, you might find yourself practicing your samba skills  :)Step by step:05min - Host presentation and welcome to the participants.05min - About: Carnival parade, competition, samba school and community.05min - Samba City, giants floats, Carnival costume and preparations for Carnival.05min - About the junior samba school (NGO).05min - Video from last carnival (The last parade of our samba school that won second place in the competition).10min - Carnival tradition - Afro-Brazilian tradition, heritage, Tia Ciata "Mother of Samba" and the first samba15min - Interactive percussion workshop, using homemade instruments such as a frying pan and wooden spoon.05min - Watch part of the last carnival parade of our NGO, the junior samba school, Pimpolhos da Grande Rio and learn more about its socio-educational mission and it's importance in preserving the samba heritage and increasing resilience of our community.05min - Farewell to the participants. See you in Brazil next carnival :)For any doubts, can send a message
about_author: I'm Cinthia, I'm 27 years old and by now I call the City of Samba my home. To be more specifically the warehouse of the Samba School Acadêmicos do Grande Rio in Rio de Janeiro.I was born in a Favela Called Vila Operaria, in the City where Grande Rio belong to Duque de Caxias, so I'was able to part of the social project supported by the youth samba school Pimpolhos da Grande Rio since I was 9. Through this project I got the chance to learn other langue, music, dance and getting more prepared to face the real life. Before the pandemic of Corona Virus I used to work as a tour guide of the Carnaval Experience receiving hundreds of people per year sharing with them the magical history, showing the behind scenes of the biggest open air show on Earth, the Rio de Janeiro's Carnival.  Now I can keep open the doors of my sweet home for you guys.

The experience was filled with surprises and videos talking more about Carnival. The performance and drumming class was fun as well! title: Stories from London's Gruesome History
address: London, United Kingdom· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
act_int: Do you have a penchant for the macabre? A morbid curiosity in the grim and gruesome? Then pull up a pew. For one hour only, London's Gruesome Stories Online will bring the darkened streets of London to your doorstep for a peek into the chilling history of one of the world's greatest cities.Starting at the world-famous London Bridge, we will intrepidly cross the River Thames and explore the grisly secrets of London's North Bank, "stopping off" at key sites such as the Tower of London and the East End. Along the way, we'll unearth stories of plague, execution, torture, and brutal crimes committed by London's most notorious criminals, which we'll bring to life with photos.Don't expect a run-of-the-mill Jack the Ripper experience. Though you'll certainly hear about the sadistic character that shook Victorian-era London, we'll introduce you to several Londoners whose twisted crimes will leave you shaken.Throw yourself into the grim and the gory by guessing the end to stories, testing your trivia knowledge, and chatting with other guests. Dominic and Sophie LOVE talking about London's Gruesome History, so make sure to ask them questions and share your own interesting tidbits!This experience is great for teams, students or groups of friends. We've already hosted private experiences for team building days, digital student union events and parties with a gruesome twist.
about_author: Dominic and Sophie are London-based actors and tour guides with a love of all things grim and grisly. Together, they host Discover London's Gruesome History, a walking tour exploring the dark and twisted history of one of the world's greatest cities which has received 400+ 5* reviews on Airbnb. Whether you're interested in pivotal moments in London's history (the Black Death, Great Fire, Gunpowder Plot, or Jack the Ripper) or want to hear lesser-known stories about London's sick and twisted characters, they have you covered. Dominic and Sophie love their city and host tours on everything ranging from feminism and Harry Potter to London's historical pubs, so feel free to ask them questions about anything!

title: Herstory; a Feminist Tour of Britain
address: London, United Kingdom· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
act_int: Do you know the difference between a Suffragette and a Suffragist? How many years you get in prison for interrupting Winston Churchill? How sheep stopped women from graduating in medicine?This powerful online experience combines two highly-rated Airbnb Experiences (with over 250 5* reviews!) exploring the history of British feminism.Using photographs, maps & props, we'll travel virtually across the UK to meet fierce women from England, Ireland, Scotland and Wales who changed the course of British history. From scientists and activists to creatives and downright bad-ass women who said "no" to the patriarchy (and often paid the price). You'll hear stories from the early 19th century to the 2010s which will show you who really runs the world (do I hear "girls!"?).Make the experience as interactive as you'd like by answering pop-quiz questions and guessing the ending to stories. We LOVE questions, so don't be shy! You'll meet other people from across the world who are passionate about equality - what could be better?This experience is fantastic for team building and corporate events. Book a private instance now or get in touch with your bespoke needs. This experience is rated a solid PG13 (strong language), so let us know if you are bringing any littl'uns.Looking forward to stamping through the shards of the glass ceiling with you.
about_author: Hi, we're Sophie & Amy!Sophie is an actor, tour guide and HUGE history buff who has been running guided tours in London for over five years. She is a passionate feminist and loves to share stories of Britain's courageous and inspirational women with anyone who's interested. Her brain is full to the brim with weird, wonderful, shocking, and often moving stories from Britain's (continuing) journey towards equality.Amy is Child.org's Creative Producer and co-creator of The Feminist Tour of London and Queen & Rebel: Edinburgh's Fierce Women.

title: Make Japanese Omurice
address: 奈良市, Japan· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
time_end: 75 mins · Hosted in English and Japanese
act_int: Omurice (a word combining omelette and rice) is a very popular Japanese dish in restaurants and in our homes.In this cooking class, we will make cooked rice with a tomato taste and wrap it with thin eggs to make a cute Lemmon shape.We will also decorate the omurice with fresh vegetables, and serve with an original avocado Japanese style dressing.The process of cooking and decorating will bring us back to feel our childhood when we first cooked something in the kitchen.Good laughs, happy smiles, and great tastes are promised.We have used this cooking class for different events: send us a request to reserve your private party for cerebrating time with friends and family, team-building, virtual travel tour, education program or a surprise party!I am very happy to help plan a cooking event specific to your request!Let’s hop in the kitchen together and make special memories with tasty omurice!Price is per person.Another very fun Japanese cooking class https://www.airbnb.jp/experiences/1684437Any device that can operate Zoom will be fine.
about_author: Hi, I am Yasuyo and have taught cooking classes at community centers in the U.S.A. when I was a university student. Since coming back to Japan, I have been cooking at local cafes, community centers, and in our home kitchen and work as an educational instructor at different schools. I learned how to cook many years ago from my grandmother, mother, and uncle, and cooking with them, I also learned many important life values and how to pay attention to the world around us. Japanese food culture is very unique and useful and can easily be used in your home kitchen. My passion is to share Japanese foods with traditional and modern approaches and also to share food culture to create positive and sustainable home kitchens around the world.

title: Japanese bento box for lunch & dinner
address: 奈良市, Japan· Part ofAirbnb Online Experiences
time_end: 90 mins · Hosted in Japanese and English
act_int: If you have an egg and a chicken in your refrigerator, I really would love you to join me in making a bento box.  This tasty and easy bento box will be easy to follow the instructions through online and will be perfect for lunch or dinner on your table!We will make Japanese egg omelets (tamagoyaki) with a regular frying pan. After we make egg omelets, we will use the same frying pan to make  a Teriyaki chicken ball with original homemade teriyaki sauce.I will demonstrate how to serve egg omelets and teriyaki chicken ball with rice, green lettuce, fruit(any kinds like apple or grapes you have) in the bento box or a glass plastic container, or wood box...If you do not have rice, you can serve without rice or if you have bread, let’s serve bread in the bento box!! Please do not worry if you don't haveJapanese rice, any kind of rice will be great!!For this online cooking class, I will use basic Japanese food ingredients: soy sauce, sake (white wine is O.K.). Bento box power is amazing!  It helps save you time to make lunch or dinner ahead and reducing washing dishes.  I hope you will save time for taking care of  yourself and enjoy the bento box!! I will making bento box from our home kitchen in  Nara, Japan.  I will use Zoom some can interact and cook together. Let's have fun!!Other things to noteAny device that can operate Zoom will be fine.
about_author: I am so grateful to have a chance to share making a Japanese style obento box with online cooking classes from our home kitchen. I learned how to cook Japanese foods (Washoku) from my family - especially from my grandmother and mother. They made many different lunch boxes for me called “obento”.  For special events like cherry blossom viewing under the tree, picnic, camping, and school lunch etc, I have many memories and stories with obento and they are unforgettable.To me,  it is not just cooking; It is cooking together to create unforgettable memories in our lives.  Now, I am very thankful to share how to make an obento box with you from our home kitchen. Cooking at our home kitchen face to face will be seen by:https://www.airbnb.jp/experiences/748784
